   <h1 class="firstHeading" id="firstHeading" lang="en">
    Comparison of text editors
   </h1>
   <div class="mw-body-content" id="bodyContent">
    <div class="noprint" id="siteSub">
     From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
    </div>
    <div id="contentSub">
    </div>
    <div id="jump-to-nav">
    </div>
    <a class="mw-jump-link" href="#mw-head">
     Jump to navigation
    </a>
    <a class="mw-jump-link" href="#p-search">
     Jump to search
    </a>
    <div class="mw-content-ltr" dir="ltr" id="mw-content-text" lang="en">
     <div class="mw-parser-output">
      <p>
       This article provides basic comparisons for common
       <a href="/wiki/Text_editor" title="Text editor">
        text editors
       </a>
       . More feature details for text editors are available from the
       <i>
        <a href="/wiki/Category:Text_editor_features" title="Category:Text editor features">
         Category of text editor features
        </a>
       </i>
       and from the individual products' articles. This article may not be up-to-date or necessarily all-inclusive.
      </p>
      <p>
       Feature comparisons are made between stable versions of software, not the upcoming versions or
       <i>
        beta
       </i>
       releases – and are exclusive of any add-ons, extensions or external programs (unless specified in footnotes).
      </p>
      <div class="toc" id="toc">
       <input class="toctogglecheckbox" id="toctogglecheckbox" role="button" style="display:none" type="checkbox"/>
       <div class="toctitle" dir="ltr" lang="en">

      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Overview">
        Overview
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Comparison_of_text_editors&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Overview">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <table class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center; font-size: 85%; width: auto; table-layout: fixed;">

      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Operating_system_support">
        Operating system support
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Comparison_of_text_editors&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: Operating system support">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <p>
       This section lists the
       <a href="/wiki/Operating_system" title="Operating system">
        operating systems
       </a>
       that different editors can run on. Some editors run on additional operating systems that are not listed.
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Cross-platform">
        Cross-platform
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Comparison_of_text_editors&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Cross-platform">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <table class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center; font-size: 85%; width: auto; table-layout: fixed;">
       <caption>
        Text editor support for various operating systems
       </caption>

      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Document_interface">
        Document interface
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Comparison_of_text_editors&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" title="Edit section: Document interface">
         edit
        </a>

        <tr class="sortbottom">
         <th>
         </th>
         <th>
          Multiple instances
         </th>
         <th>
          Single document window splitting
         </th>
         <th>
          MDI: overlappable windows
         </th>
         <th>
          MDI: tabbed document interface
         </th>
         <th>
          MDI: window splitting
         </th>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">
        Notes
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Comparison_of_text_editors&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" title="Edit section: Notes">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <b>
         Multiple instances
        </b>
        : multiple instances of the program can be opened simultaneously for editing multiple files. Applies both for
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Single_document_interface" title="Single document interface">
         single document interface
        </a>
        (SDI) and multiple document interface (MDI) programs. Also applies for program that has a user interface that looks like multiple instances of the same program (such as some versions of
        <a href="/wiki/Microsoft_Word" title="Microsoft Word">
         Microsoft Word
        </a>
        ).
       </li>
       <li>
        <b>
         Single document window splitting
        </b>
        : window can be split to simultaneously view different areas of a file.
       </li>
       <li>
        <b>
         MDI: Overlappable windows
        </b>
        : each opened document gets its own fully movable window inside the editor environment.
       </li>
       <li>
        <b>
         MDI: Tabbed document interface
        </b>
        : multiple documents can be viewed as tabs in a single window.
       </li>
       <li>
        <b>
         MDI: Window splitting
        </b>
        : splitting application window to show multiple documents (non-overlapping windows).
       </li>
      </ul>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Basic_features">
        Basic features
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Comparison_of_text_editors&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7" title="Edit section: Basic features">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <table class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center; font-size: 85%; width: auto; table-layout: fixed;">

      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Programming_features">
        Programming features
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Comparison_of_text_editors&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8" title="Edit section: Programming features">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <table class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center; font-size: 85%; width: auto; table-layout: fixed;">
       <caption>
        Text editor support for programming features (see
        <a href="/wiki/Source_code_editor" title="Source code editor">
         source code editor
        </a>
        )
       </caption>
       <tbody>
        <tr>
         <th style="width: 12em">
         </th>
         <th>
          <a href="/wiki/Syntax_highlighting" title="Syntax highlighting">
           Syntax highlighting
          </a>
         </th>
         <th>
          Function list
         </th>
         <th>
          Symbol database
          <br/>
          (
          <a href="/wiki/Ctags" title="Ctags">
           ctags
          </a>
          or equiv.)
         </th>
         <th>
          <a href="/wiki/Brace_matching" title="Brace matching">
           Brace matching
          </a>
         </th>
         <th>
          Auto indentation
         </th>
         <th>
          <a href="/wiki/Autocomplete" title="Autocomplete">
           Auto completion
          </a>
         </th>
         <th>
          <a href="/wiki/Code_folding" title="Code folding">
           Code folding
          </a>
         </th>
         <th>
          <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Text_folding" title="Text folding">
           Text folding
          </a>
         </th>
         <th>
          <a href="/wiki/Compiler" title="Compiler">
           Compiler
          </a>
          integration
         </th>

        <tr class="sortbottom">
         <th>
         </th>
         <th>
          Syntax highlighting
         </th>
         <th>
          Function list
         </th>
         <th>
          Symbol database
          <br/>
          (ctags or equiv.)
         </th>
         <th>
          Bracket matching
         </th>
         <th>
          Auto indentation
         </th>
         <th>
          Auto completion
         </th>
         <th>
          Code folding
         </th>
         <th>
          Text folding
         </th>
         <th>
          Compiler integration
         </th>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Notes_2">
        Notes
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Comparison_of_text_editors&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9" title="Edit section: Notes">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <ul>
       <li>
        <b>
         Syntax highlighting
        </b>
        : Displays text in different colors and fonts according to the category of terms.
       </li>
       <li>
        <b>
         Function list
        </b>
        : Lists all functions from current file in a window or sidebar and allows user to jump directly to the definition of that function for example by double-clicking on the function name in the list. More or less realtime (does not require creating a symbol database, see below).
       </li>
       <li>
        <b>
         Symbol database
        </b>
        : Database of functions, variable and type definitions, macro definitions etc. in all the files belonging to the software being developed. The database can be created by the editor itself or by an external program such as ctags. The database can be used to instantly locate the definition even if it is in another file.
       </li>
       <li>
        <b>
         Bracket matching
        </b>
        : Find matching parenthesis or bracket, taking into account nesting.
       </li>
       <li>
        <b>
         Auto indentation
        </b>
        : May refer to just simple
        <a href="/wiki/Indentation_(typesetting)" title="Indentation (typesetting)">
         indenting
        </a>
        to the same level as the line above, or intelligent indenting that is language specific, e.g., ensuring a given
        <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Indent_style" title="Indent style">
         indent style
        </a>
        .
       </li>
       <li>
        <b>
         Compiler integration
        </b>
        : Allows running compilers/linkers/debuggers from within editor, capturing the compiler output and stepping through errors, automatically moving cursor to corresponding location in the source file.
       </li>
      </ul>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Extra_features">
        Extra features
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Comparison_of_text_editors&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10" title="Edit section: Extra features">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <table class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center; font-size: 85%; width: auto; table-layout: fixed;">

        <tr class="sortbottom">
         <th>
         </th>
         <th>
          Text shell integration
         </th>
         <th>
          Graphical shell integration
         </th>
         <th>
          Macro language
         </th>
         <th>
          Collaborative editing
         </th>
         <th>
          Large file support
         </th>
         <th>
          Long line support
         </th>
         <th>
          Multi-line regex support
         </th>
         <th>
          Search in files
         </th>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table>
      <p>
       <span id="ref_lfs">
       </span>
       <b>
        Large file support:
       </b>
      </p>
      <table cellpadding="1" style="margin-left:1em; font-size: 90%">
       <tbody>
        <tr>
         <td class="table-yes" style="background:#9F9;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center;">
          Yes
         </td>
         <td>
          = Larger than 4 GB (
          <a href="/wiki/Large_file_support" title="Large file support">
           LFS
          </a>
          )
         </td>
         <td class="table-yes2" style="background:#bfd; color:black; vertical-align:middle; text-align:center;">
          2 GB
         </td>
         <td>
          = Larger than 1 GB, not limited by memory
         </td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
         <td class="partial table-partial" style="background: #FFD; color: black; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;">
          memory
         </td>
         <td>
          = Limited by available memory
         </td>
         <td class="table-no" style="background:#F99;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center;">
          No (64 KB)
         </td>
         <td>
          = Some limit less than available memory (give max size if known)
         </td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table>
      <p>
       In general, most text editors do not support large text files. Some restrict themselves to available in-core RAM while others use sophisticated virtual memory management techniques and paging algorithms.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-large_text_editors_108-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-large_text_editors-108">
         [108]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       <b>
        Search in files:
       </b>
       Perform search (and possibly replace) in multiple files on disk, for example on a sub-directory and recursively all the directories below it.
Similar to
       <a href="/wiki/Grep" title="Grep">
        grep
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Key_bindings">
        Key bindings
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Comparison_of_text_editors&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11" title="Edit section: Key bindings">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <p>
       Support for
       <a href="/wiki/Keyboard_shortcut#Customization" title="Keyboard shortcut">
        custom key bindings
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <table class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center; font-size: 85%; width: auto; table-layout: fixed;">
       <caption>
        Text editor support for key bindings.
       </caption>

      <h3>
       <span id="Notes.2C_bugs">
       </span>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Notes,_bugs">
        Notes, bugs
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Comparison_of_text_editors&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12" title="Edit section: Notes, bugs">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <ul>
       <li>
        Vim: custom maps of Ctrl-1 .. Ctrl-9, Ctrl-0 cannot be set, nor is Control-Shift-&lt;char&gt; distinguished from Ctrl-&lt;char&gt;.
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-134">
         <a href="#cite_note-134">
          [134]
         </a>
        </sup>
        <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-135">
         <a href="#cite_note-135">
          [135]
         </a>
        </sup>
       </li>
       <li>
        Notepad++: custom shortcuts of Shift-&lt;char&gt; cannot be set, they need an added modifier such as Ctrl or Alt. i.e. SCI_LINESCROLLUP cannot be bound to "Shift-I" as the "Add" button is greyed out.
       </li>
       <li>
        Emacs and Pico: pico uses most of Emacs's motion and deletion commands: ^F ^B ^P ^N ^D etc.
       </li>
      </ul>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Protocol_support">
        Protocol support
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Comparison_of_text_editors&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13" title="Edit section: Protocol support">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <p>
       Support for editing files over a network or the Internet.
      </p>
      <table class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center; font-size: 85%; width: auto; table-layout: fixed;">
       <caption>
        Text editor support for remote file editing over
        <a href="/wiki/Lists_of_network_protocols" title="Lists of network protocols">
         network protocols
        </a>
       </caption>
       <tbody>
        <tr>
         <th style="width: 12em">

           HTTP
          </a>

      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Unicode_and_other_character_encodings">
        Unicode and other character encodings
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Comparison_of_text_editors&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14" title="Edit section: Unicode and other character encodings">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <p>
       To support specified character encoding, the editor must be able to load, save, view and edit text in the specific encoding and not destroy any characters. For UTF-8 and UTF-16, this requires internal 16-bit character support.
      </p>
      <p>
       <b>
        Partial
       </b>
       support is indicated if: 1) the editor can only
       <i>
        convert
       </i>
       the character encoding to internal (8-bit) format for editing.
2) If some encodings are supported only in
       <i>
        some platforms
       </i>
       .
3) If the editor can only
       <i>
        display
       </i>
       specific character set (such as OEM) by loading corresponding font, but does not support keyboard entry for that character set.
      </p>
      <table class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center; font-size: 85%; width: auto; table-layout: fixed;">
       <caption>
        Text editor support for some of the most common
        <a href="/wiki/Character_encoding" title="Character encoding">
         character encodings
        </a>
       </caption>
       <tbody>
        <tr>
         <th style="width: 12em">
         </th>
         <th>
          <a href="/wiki/ASCII" title="ASCII">
           ASCII
          </a>
         </th>
         <th>
          <a href="/wiki/ISO/IEC_8859" title="ISO/IEC 8859">
           ISO-8859
          </a>
         </th>
         <th>
          <a href="/wiki/Code_page_437" title="Code page 437">
           DOS (OEM)
          </a>
         </th>
         <th>
          <a href="/wiki/EBCDIC" title="EBCDIC">
           EBCDIC
          </a>
         </th>
         <th>
          <a href="/wiki/UTF-8" title="UTF-8">
           UTF-8
          </a>
         </th>
         <th>
          <a href="/wiki/UTF-16" title="UTF-16">
           UTF-16
          </a>
         </th>
        </tr>
        <tr>
         <th class="table-rh" style="background: #ececec; color: black; font-weight: bold; vertical-align: middle; text-align: left;">
          <a href="/wiki/Acme_(text_editor)" title="Acme (text editor)">
           Acme
          </a>
         </th>
         <td class="table-yes" style="background:#9F9;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center;">
          Yes
         </td>
         <td class="unknown table-unknown" style="background: #ececec; color: #2C2C2C; font-size: smaller; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;">
          ?
         </td>
         <td class="unknown table-unknown" style="background: #ececec; color: #2C2C2C; font-size: smaller; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;">
          ?
         </td>
         <td class="unknown table-unknown" style="background: #ececec; color: #2C2C2C; font-size: smaller; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;">
          ?
         </td>

         <td class="table-yes" style="background:#9F9;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center;">
          Yes
          <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-XEmacs_Unicode_160-0">
           <a href="#cite_note-XEmacs_Unicode-160">
            [160]
           </a>
          </sup>
         </td>
         <td class="table-yes" style="background:#9F9;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center;">
          Yes
         </td>
        </tr>

         <th class="table-rh" style="background: #ececec; color: black; font-weight: bold; vertical-align: middle; text-align: left;">

          </a>
         </th>
         <td class="table-yes" style="background:#9F9;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center;">

         </th>

       </tbody>
      </table>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Right-to-left_and_bidirectional_text">
        Right-to-left and bidirectional text
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Comparison_of_text_editors&amp;action=edit&amp;section=15" title="Edit section: Right-to-left and bidirectional text">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <p>
       Support for
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Right-To-Left" title="Right-To-Left">
        Right-To-Left
       </a>
       (RTL) texts is necessary for editing some languages like
       <a href="/wiki/Arabic" title="Arabic">
        Arabic
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Persian_language" title="Persian language">
        Persian
       </a>
       ,
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Hebrew" title="Hebrew">
        Hebrew
       </a>
       , and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Yiddish_language" title="Yiddish language">
        Yiddish
       </a>
       and the mixture of left to right (LTR) and RTL known as bi-directional (
       <a href="/wiki/Bi-directional_text" title="Bi-directional text">
        BiDi
       </a>
       ) support.
      </p>
      <p>
       Depending on the algorithm used in the programs it might only render the bidirectional text correctly but may not be able to edit them. (e.g. Notepad++ 5.1.3 shows bidirectional texts correctly but cannot edit it and user should change the text direction to RTL to be able to edit RTL texts correctly.)
      </p>
      <table class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center; font-size: 85%; width: auto; table-layout: fixed;">
       <caption>
        Right to left (RTL) &amp; bidirectional (bidi) support
       </caption>
       <tbody>
        <tr>
         <th style="width: 12em">
         </th>
         <th>
          Right-to-left (RTL)
         </th>
         <th>
          Bi-directional (Bidi)
         </th>
        </tr>
        <tr>

      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Newline_support">
        Newline support
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Comparison_of_text_editors&amp;action=edit&amp;section=16" title="Edit section: Newline support">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <table class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center; font-size: 85%; width: auto; table-layout: fixed;">
       <caption>
        Support for
        <a href="/wiki/Newline" title="Newline">
         newline
        </a>
        characters in line endings
       </caption>
       <tbody>
        <tr>
         <th style="width: 12em">
         </th>
         <th>
          <a href="/wiki/Microsoft_Windows" title="Microsoft Windows">
           Windows
          </a>
          (CR/LF)
         </th>
         <th>
          <a href="/wiki/Unix-like" title="Unix-like">
           Unix-like
          </a>
          systems (including
          <a href="/wiki/MacOS" title="MacOS">
           macOS
          </a>
          <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-164">
           <a href="#cite_note-164">
            [164]
           </a>
          </sup>
          ) (LF)
         </th>
         <th>
          <a href="/wiki/Classic_Mac_OS" title="Classic Mac OS">
           Classic Mac OS
          </a>
          (CR)
         </th>
        </tr>
        <tr>
         <th class="table-rh" style="background: #ececec; color: black; font-weight: bold; vertical-align: middle; text-align: left;">

      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="See_also">

      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Notes_and_references">
        Notes and references
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Comparison_of_text_editors&amp;action=edit&amp;section=18" title="Edit section: Notes and references">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;">
       <div class="mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns">
        <ol class="references">
         <li id="cite_note-gedit_mac-1">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           ^
           <a href="#cite_ref-gedit_mac_1-0">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               a
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
           <a href="#cite_ref-gedit_mac_1-1">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               b
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <a class="external text" href="http://projects.gnome.org/gedit/" rel="nofollow">
            GEdit
           </a>
           , when installed from MacPorts, runs in X11 and, therefore, does not have a native look and feel. However, precompiled native macOS binaries for GEdit may be downloaded from the GEdit project page, or from the
           <a class="external text" href="ftp://ftp.gnome.org/pub/gnome/binaries/mac/gedit/" rel="nofollow">
            GEdit FTP download server
           </a>
           .
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-JedMinInstSIZE-2">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-JedMinInstSIZE_2-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           Includes 1.34M S-Lang Runtime
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-plan9windows-3">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           ^
           <a href="#cite_ref-plan9windows_3-0">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               a
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
           <a href="#cite_ref-plan9windows_3-1">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               b
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           No native support, available as a part of the
           <a href="/wiki/Inferno_(operating_system)" title="Inferno (operating system)">
            Inferno
           </a>
           port for Windows.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-cygwin-4">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           ^
           <a href="#cite_ref-cygwin_4-0">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               a
              </b>
             </i>

            <sup>

              <b>

              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
           <a href="#cite_ref-cygwin_4-2">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               c
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
           <a href="#cite_ref-cygwin_4-3">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               d
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           Requires Cygwin to run on Windows.
          </span>

         <li id="cite_note-epsilon13-5">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-epsilon13_5-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <cite class="citation web">
            <a class="external text" href="http://www.lugaru.com/newv13.html" rel="nofollow">
             "Epsilon version 13"
            </a>
            .
           </cite>
           <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Epsilon+version+13&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.lugaru.com%2Fnewv13.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AComparison+of+text+editors">
            <span style="display:none;">
            </span>
           </span>
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-geditOSX-6">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           ^
           <a href="#cite_ref-geditOSX_6-0">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               a
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
           <a href="#cite_ref-geditOSX_6-1">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               b
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            gedit
           </i>
           ,
           <i>
            NEdit
           </i>
           , and
           <i>
            SciTE
           </i>
           run in the
           <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/X11" title="X11">
            X11
           </a>
           window environment, and therefore do not use the native Aqua look-and-feel when running on macOS.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-7">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-7">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <cite class="citation web">
            <a class="external text" href="https://sourceforge.net/p/joe-editor/mercurial/ci/default/tree/po/" rel="nofollow">
             "JOE - Joe's own editor"
            </a>
            .
            <i>
             JOE - Joe's own editor / Mercurial / [2e4f45] /po
            </i>
            <span class="reference-accessdate">
             . Retrieved
             <span class="nowrap">
              23 October
             </span>
             2015
            </span>
            .
           </cite>
           <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=JOE+-+Joe%26%2339%3Bs+own+editor+%2F+Mercurial+%2F+%5B2e4f45%5D+%2Fpo&amp;rft.atitle=JOE+-+Joe%27s+own+editor&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fsourceforge.net%2Fp%2Fjoe-editor%2Fmercurial%2Fci%2Fdefault%2Ftree%2Fpo%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AComparison+of+text+editors">
            <span style="display:none;">
            </span>
           </span>
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-8">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-8">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <cite class="citation web">
            <a class="external text" href="http://l10n.kde.org/stats/gui/stable/po/kate.po/" rel="nofollow">
             "KDE Localization - Apps » stable » kate.po"
            </a>
            .
           </cite>
           <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=KDE+Localization+-+Apps+%C2%BB+stable+%C2%BB+kate.po&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fl10n.kde.org%2Fstats%2Fgui%2Fstable%2Fpo%2Fkate.po%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AComparison+of+text+editors">
            <span style="display:none;">
            </span>
           </span>
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-9">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-9">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <cite class="citation web">
            <a class="external text" href="http://liquidninja.com/metapad/translations-download.html" rel="nofollow">
             "Metapad language plugins"
            </a>
            .
           </cite>
           <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Metapad+language+plugins&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fliquidninja.com%2Fmetapad%2Ftranslations-download.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AComparison+of+text+editors">
            <span style="display:none;">
            </span>
           </span>
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-10">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-10">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <cite class="citation web">
            <a class="external text" href="http://scintilla.org/SciTETranslation.html" rel="nofollow">
             "SciTE in languages other than English"
            </a>
            .
           </cite>
           <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=SciTE+in+languages+other+than+English&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fscintilla.org%2FSciTETranslation.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AComparison+of+text+editors">
            <span style="display:none;">
            </span>
           </span>
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-11">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-11">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            gedit
           </i>
           supports single document window splitting via plug-ins.
           <a class="external autonumber" href="http://live.gnome.org/Gedit/Plugins" rel="nofollow">
            [1]
           </a>
           .
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-12">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-12">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            gedit
           </i>
           supports multiple document window splitting via plug-ins.
           <a class="external autonumber" href="http://live.gnome.org/Gedit/Plugins" rel="nofollow">
            [2]
           </a>
           .
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-tabbar-13">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-tabbar_13-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           GNU Emacs can use a tabbed document interface in a non OS-native way, using the
           <i>
            tabbar
           </i>
           plug-in.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-elscreen-14">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-elscreen_14-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           GNU Emacs can support a tabbed document interface modelled after
           <a href="/wiki/GNU_Screen" title="GNU Screen">
            GNU Screen
           </a>
           using the
           <a class="external text" href="http://www.morishima.net/~naoto/software/elscreen/" rel="nofollow">
            elscreen
           </a>
           package.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-joetabs-15">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-joetabs_15-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            JOE
           </i>
           supports editing multiple files but only seeing one of them, and switching to others via Ctrl+K+N, which is functionally equivalent to having tabs but no visible tab bar.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-16">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-16">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            mined
           </i>
           supports Copy/Paste between multiple documents in separate windows, when these documents are in separate terminal windows
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-SciTE_max_buffers-17">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-SciTE_max_buffers_17-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            SciTE
           </i>
           has a maximum number of buffers, which can only be set as high as 100.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-vimOV-18">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-vimOV_18-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            Vim
           </i>
           Provided GVim is used.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-vimTDI-19">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-vimTDI_19-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            Vim
           </i>
           version 7 supports a tabbed document interface. Earlier versions can emulate tabs through scripts, for example
           <a class="external text" href="http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=1338" rel="nofollow">
            TabBar
           </a>
           .
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-acmeext-20">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           ^
           <a href="#cite_ref-acmeext_20-0">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               a
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
           <a href="#cite_ref-acmeext_20-1">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               b
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
           <a href="#cite_ref-acmeext_20-2">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               c
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
           <a href="#cite_ref-acmeext_20-3">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               d
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           Acme can invoke external commands and display their return values in order to integrate additional functionality.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-ConTEXT_regex-21">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-ConTEXT_regex_21-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            ConTEXT
           </i>
           does not support regular expression backreferences in its search and replace function.
           <a class="external autonumber" href="http://www.context.cx/" rel="nofollow">
            [3]
           </a>
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-ConTEXT_Character_Encoding-22">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-ConTEXT_Character_Encoding_22-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            ConTEXT
           </i>
           only supports converting text to
           <a href="/wiki/UTF-16" title="UTF-16">
            UTF-16
           </a>
           . Also, it can only use one type of new-line format if converting to UTF-16.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-eSpellChecking-23">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-eSpellChecking_23-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            e
           </i>
           supports spell checking via a bundle command available at the
           <a class="external text" href="https://code.google.com/p/ebundles/" rel="nofollow">
            e Bundles repository
           </a>
           .
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-24">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-24">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            Geany
           </i>
           supports spell checking
           <a class="external text" href="http://geany-plugins.sourceforge.net/spellcheck/" rel="nofollow">
            via a plug-in
           </a>
           <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20080924214738/http://geany-plugins.sourceforge.net/spellcheck/" rel="nofollow">
            Archived
           </a>
           2008-09-24 at the
           <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">
            Wayback Machine
           </a>
           ., but
           <a class="external text" href="https://sourceforge.net/support/tracker.php?aid=2835734" rel="nofollow">
            not for Windows
           </a>
           at the moment.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-geditSpellChecking-25">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-geditSpellChecking_25-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            gedit
           </i>
           supports spell checking via a plug-in, which is distributed with gedit.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-26">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-26">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            gedit
           </i>
           supports Regex-based find &amp; replace via plug-ins (
           <a class="external autonumber" href="http://live.gnome.org/Gedit/Plugins" rel="nofollow">
            [4]
           </a>
           ).
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-27">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-27">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <cite class="citation web">
            <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20120111004835/http://live.gnome.org/Gedit/Plugins/ColumnMode" rel="nofollow">
             "Gedit/Plugins/ColumnMode - GNOME Wiki!"
            </a>
            . Archived from
            <a class="external text" href="https://live.gnome.org/Gedit/Plugins/ColumnMode" rel="nofollow">
             the original
            </a>
            on 2012-01-11.
           </cite>
           <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Gedit%2FPlugins%2FColumnMode+-+GNOME+Wiki%21&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Flive.gnome.org%2FGedit%2FPlugins%2FColumnMode&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AComparison+of+text+editors">
            <span style="display:none;">
            </span>
           </span>
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-emacs_spell-28">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           ^
           <a href="#cite_ref-emacs_spell_28-0">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               a
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
           <a href="#cite_ref-emacs_spell_28-1">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               b
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           Emacs supports spell checking via the external programs
           <a href="/wiki/Ispell" title="Ispell">
            ispell
           </a>
           ,
           <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Aspell" title="Aspell">
            aspell
           </a>
           , or
           <a href="/wiki/Hunspell" title="Hunspell">
            Hunspell
           </a>
           .
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-jeditSpellChecking-29">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-jeditSpellChecking_29-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            jEdit
           </i>
           supports spell checking via an external plug-in.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-joeSpellChecking-30">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-joeSpellChecking_30-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            JOE
           </i>
           supports spell checking via the
           <a href="/wiki/Ispell" title="Ispell">
            ispell
           </a>
           or
           <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Aspell" title="Aspell">
            aspell
           </a>
           external plug-ins.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-joeRegexp-31">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-joeRegexp_31-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            JOE
           </i>
           uses a non-standard regular expression syntax.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-joeCharset-32">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-joeCharset_32-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            JOE
           </i>
           can easily pipe text through the GNU
           <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Recode_(Unix)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Recode (Unix) (page does not exist)">
            recode
           </a>
           (1) utility; it detects locale settings and allows editing in any encoding set up by the environment.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-LECharset-33">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-LECharset_33-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            LE
           </i>
           can pipe text through the GNU
           <a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Recode_(Unix)&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Recode (Unix) (page does not exist)">
            recode
           </a>
           (1) utility
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-LT-Spelling-34">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-LT-Spelling_34-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <a class="external free" href="https://github.com/rschroll/lt-spelling" rel="nofollow">
            https://github.com/rschroll/lt-spelling
           </a>
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-metapadSpellChecking-35">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-metapadSpellChecking_35-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            Metapad
           </i>
           spell checking by calling external program Aspell.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-mgUndo-36">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           ^
           <a href="#cite_ref-mgUndo_36-0">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               a
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
           <a href="#cite_ref-mgUndo_36-1">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               b
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <a class="external free" href="http://openbsd.su/src/usr.bin/mg/re_search.c" rel="nofollow">
            http://openbsd.su/src/usr.bin/mg/re_search.c
           </a>
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-37">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-37">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            mined
           </i>
           supports multiple lines in search and replacement expressions.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-38">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-38">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            mined
           </i>
           can convert the encoding format when using the Copy &amp; Paste feature between multiple documents (that have different encodings).
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-39">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-39">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            mined
           </i>
           supports new-line conversion via a command-line option or from the menu. Files with mixed newline types can be edited transparently; different kinds of new-line have different visual indications.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-neditSpellChecking-40">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-neditSpellChecking_40-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            NEdit
           </i>
           supports spell checking via a plug-in
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-nppSpellChecking-41">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-nppSpellChecking_41-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <a class="external text" href="http://notepad-plus-plus.org/news/notepad-6.3.3-release.html" rel="nofollow">
            <i>
             Notepad++ 6.3.3
            </i>
           </a>
           and above support spell checking via the DSpellCheck plug-in, which is included with the default package.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-Scintilla_regex-42">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           ^
           <a href="#cite_ref-Scintilla_regex_42-0">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               a
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
           <a href="#cite_ref-Scintilla_regex_42-1">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               b
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            Scintilla
           </i>
           -based editors such as
           <i>
            SciTE
           </i>
           ,
           <i>
            Notepad2
           </i>
           and
           <i>
            Notepad++
           </i>
           do not support alternation (|) in regular expressions.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-subEthaEditBlockEditing-43">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-subEthaEditBlockEditing_43-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            SubEthaEdit
           </i>
           supports advanced block editing, including multi-line typing and non-contiguous block selections.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-UERegexp-44">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-UERegexp_44-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            UltraEdit
           </i>
           uses the Boost C++ regex library.  While Boost supports backreferences past \9 with \g{10}, UltraEdit has not yet implemented this feature.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-VeditSpellChecking-45">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-VeditSpellChecking_45-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            VEDIT
           </i>
           6.2 comes with Scribe spelling checker which has been written entirely in Vedit macro language. In addition, macro package for integrating
           <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Aspell" title="Aspell">
            Aspell
           </a>
           can be downloaded
           <a class="external text" href="http://koti.mbnet.fi/pkl/vedit/aspell.htm" rel="nofollow">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-vimSpellChecking-46">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-vimSpellChecking_46-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            Vim
           </i>
           version 7 supports spell checking natively. Earlier versions require a script shown
           <a class="external text" href="http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=195" rel="nofollow">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-47">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">

            <a href="#cite_ref-47">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           Acme's auto-completion only works on file names.
          </span>
         </li>

             ^
            </a>

          <span class="reference-text">

            TextWrangler
           </i>
           can integrate with a compiler if you write a shell script that takes flag input of the code and compiles it. You place this in ~/Library/Application Support/TextWrangler/Unix Support/Unix Filters/. It should show in the #! menu.

         <li id="cite_note-82">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">

             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-bbeditMacro-83">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-bbeditMacro_83-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            BBEdit
           </i>
           Macro support via
           <a href="/wiki/AppleScript" title="AppleScript">
            AppleScript
           </a>
           ,
           <a href="/wiki/Perl" title="Perl">
            Perl
           </a>
           ,
           <a href="/wiki/Python_(programming_language)" title="Python (programming language)">
            Python
           </a>
           ,
           <a href="/wiki/Lasso_(programming_language)" title="Lasso (programming language)">
            Lasso
           </a>
           ,
           <a href="/wiki/Unix_shell" title="Unix shell">
            shell
           </a>
           scripts or text factories.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-bbeditBigFile-84">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           ^
           <a href="#cite_ref-bbeditBigFile_84-0">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               a
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
           <a href="#cite_ref-bbeditBigFile_84-1">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               b
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            BBEdit
           </i>
           and
           <i>
            TextWrangler
           </i>
           are technically capable of any size file, but limited practically by RAM and macOS limitation to files = 384mb. Cf.
           <a class="external text" href="http://faq.barebones.com/do_getanswer.php?record_id=36" rel="nofollow">
            BBEdit FAQ Entry 36
           </a>
           <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070609111447/http://faq.barebones.com/do_getanswer.php?record_id=36" rel="nofollow">
            Archived
           </a>
           2007-06-09 at the
           <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">
            Wayback Machine
           </a>
           ..
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-codaMacroLanguage-85">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-codaMacroLanguage_85-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            Coda
           </i>
           offers macros via AppleScript, text "clips," or plug-ins (Cocoa apps or any installed scripting language).
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-contextBigFile-86">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-contextBigFile_86-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            ConTEXT
           </i>
           claims Large File Support but load time is proportional to file size and a 1 GB file gave an Out of Memory error.
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-eMacro-87">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-eMacro_87-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            e
           </i>
           Macro support via
           <a href="/wiki/Cygwin" title="Cygwin">
            Cygwin
           </a>
           and languages like
           <a href="/wiki/Ruby_(programming_language)" title="Ruby (programming language)">
            Ruby
           </a>
           ,
           <a href="/wiki/Python_(programming_language)" title="Python (programming language)">
            Python
           </a>
           , or
           <a href="/wiki/Perl" title="Perl">
            Perl
           </a>
           .
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-pythonMacro-88">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-pythonMacro_88-0">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <i>
            Cssed
           </i>
           Macro support via
           <a href="/wiki/Python_(programming_language)" title="Python (programming language)">
            Python
           </a>
           .
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-EmacsFSLimit-89">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           ^
           <a href="#cite_ref-EmacsFSLimit_89-0">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               a
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
           <a href="#cite_ref-EmacsFSLimit_89-1">
            <sup>
             <i>
              <b>
               b
              </b>
             </i>
            </sup>
           </a>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           Emacs: 64-bit compilation on 64-bit OS can handle 2 GB files, otherwise the limit is 512
           <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/MiB" title="MiB">
            MiB
           </a>
           .
           <a class="external autonumber" href="https://www.gnu.org/software/emacs/NEWS.23.2" rel="nofollow">
            [8]
           </a>
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-90">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-90">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <cite class="citation web">
            <a class="external text" href="https://www.gnu.org/software/emacs/manual/html_node/emacs/Buffers.html" rel="nofollow">
             "Buffers"
            </a>
            .
            <q>
             A buffer’s size cannot be larger than some maximum, which is defined by the largest buffer position representable by Emacs integers. This is because Emacs tracks buffer positions using that data type. For typical 64-bit machines, this maximum buffer size is 2^{61} - 2 bytes, or about 2 EiB. For typical 32-bit machines, the maximum is usually 2^{29} - 2 bytes, or about 512 MiB. Buffer sizes are also limited by the amount of memory in the system.
            </q>
           </cite>
           <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Buffers&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.gnu.org%2Fsoftware%2Femacs%2Fmanual%2Fhtml_node%2Femacs%2FBuffers.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AComparison+of+text+editors">
            <span style="display:none;">
            </span>
           </span>
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-91">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-91">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <cite class="citation web">
            <a class="external text" href="http://www.fi.infn.it/info/jed/jed.pdf" rel="nofollow">
             "The JED Editor"
            </a>
            <span style="font-size:85%;">
             (PDF)
            </span>
            .
           </cite>
           <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=The+JED+Editor&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.fi.infn.it%2Finfo%2Fjed%2Fjed.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AComparison+of+text+editors">
            <span style="display:none;">
            </span>
           </span>
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-92">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-92">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           jEdit: Limited by Java heap size.
           <a class="external text" href="http://marc.info/?l=jedit-users&amp;m=113229204827690&amp;w=2" rel="nofollow">
            jedit-users forum
           </a>
          </span>
         </li>
         <li id="cite_note-93">
          <span class="mw-cite-backlink">
           <b>
            <a href="#cite_ref-93">
             ^
            </a>
           </b>
          </span>
          <span class="reference-text">
           <cite class="citation web">
            <a class="external text" href="https://sourceforge.net/p/joe-editor/mercurial/ci/default/tree/docs/man.md#searching-for-text" rel="nofollow">
             "JOE - Joe's Own Editor"
            </a>
            .
            <i>
             JOE - Joe's own editor / Mercurial / [2e4f45] /docs/man.md
            </i>
            <span class="reference-accessdate">
             . Retrieved
             <span class="nowrap">
              23 October
             </span>
             2015
            </span>
            .
            <q>
             The search covers all loaded buffers.
            </q>
           </cite>
           <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=JOE+-+Joe%26%2339%3Bs+own+editor+%2F+Mercurial+%2F+%5B2e4f45%5D+%2Fdocs%2Fman.md&amp;rft.atitle=JOE+-+Joe%27s+Own+Editor&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fsourceforge.net%2Fp%2Fjoe-editor%2Fmercurial%2Fci%2Fdefault%2Ftree%2Fdocs%2Fman.md%23searching-for-text&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AComparison+of+text+editors">
            <span style="display:none;">
            </span>
           </span>
          </span>

           </a>
           -shared mode
          </span>

           <span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Bare+Bones+Software+%26%23124%3B+Features+%28BBEdit%29&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.barebones.com%2Fproducts%2Fbbedit%2Ffeatures.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AComparison+of+text+editors">
